thread.title: Blue Jays-Rangers ALDS Game 4 lineups: Beltre talks his way in
thread.title_full: Blue Jays-Rangers ALDS Game 4 lineups: Beltre talks his way in - CBSSports.com

author: Dayn Perry
title: Blue Jays-Rangers ALDS Game 4 lineups: Beltre talks his way in
text:
Game 4 of the ALDS between the Blue Jays and Rangers goes down in Arlington on Monday ( TOR-TEX preview/GameTracker ), with first pitch scheduled for 4:07 pm ET. Derek Holland will oppose R.A. Dickey , as the visiting Blue Jays try to force a deciding Game 5 back in Toronto. Here are Monday's lineups ... 
Visiting Blue Jays 
1. Ben Revere , LF
2. Josh Donaldson , 3B
3. Jose Bautista , RF
4. Edwin Encarnacion , DH
5. Chris Colabello , 1B
6. Troy Tulowitzki , SS
7. Russell Martin , C
8. Kevin Pillar , CF
9. Ryan Goins , 2B
SP - R.A. Dickey
Only change from Game 3 for the Jays is that Martin returns behind the plate. 
Home Rangers 
1. Delino DeShields , CF
2. Shin-Soo Choo , RF
3. Adrian Beltre, 3B
4. Prince Fielder , DH
5. Mitch Moreland , 1B
6. Elvis Andrus , SS
7. Josh Hamilton , LF
8. Robinson Chirinos , C
9. Rougned Odor , 2B
SP - Derek Holland
Linchpin third baseman Adrian Beltre wasn't in manager Jeff Banister's original lineup, as he's been sidelined since suffering a lower back injury in Game 1. But then Mr. Beltre went to his powers of persuasion ...
Beltre has talked his way into lineup. Playing third. Batting third.
â€” Evan Grant (@Evan_P_Grant) October 12, 2015 Given the lengths he went to in an attempt to stay in the game in the series opener, this shouldn't be too surprising. The man is a ballplayer. The injured Adrian Beltre still isn't ready to return to the Texas lineup. (USATSI) Topics: Adrian Beltre , Ben Revere , Chris Colabello , Delino DeShields , Derek Holland , Edwin Encarnacion , Elvis Andrus , Hanser Alberto , Jose Bautista , Josh Donaldson , Josh Hamilton , Kevin Pillar , Mitch Moreland , Prince Fielder , R.A. Dickey , Robinson Chirinos , Rougned Odor , Russell Martin , Ryan Goins , Shin-Soo Choo , Troy Tulowitzki , Texas Rangers , Toronto Blue Jays , MLB
